data.title: O Girlfriend
data.text:
Not to be confused with "O Girl" or "Girlfriend."

"O Girlfriend" (sometimes rendered as "Oh Girlfriend") is the tenth and final song from The Green Album.

Appearances

Weezer (The Green Album)

Overview

When I lived in the top of Beachwood Canyon—it's this big hill in Hollywood, up by the Hollywood sign—my girlfriend lived at the bottom of the hill. It was so convenient; every time I went out or came back home I'd go by her house and stop in for a bit. But then when we broke up it really sucked, 'cause every time I went out or came back I had to go by her house. So this song was about that feeling, going by her house.

—Rivers Cuomo, Madison, WI, June 2023[1]

"O Girlfriend" was written by Rivers Cuomo in 2000 about a "half-Asian"[2] ex-girlfriend (the same girlfriend who inspired the 2000 song "O Girl" and the 2016 song "Do You Wanna Get High?"[3]) Weezer began rehearsing "O Girlfriend" at Cuomo's garage rehearsal space in November of 2000, the month before the band entered the studio to record The Green Album. The song was among fourteen un-mastered Green Album tracks that leaked in the spring of 2001.

"O Girlfriend" was only performed live as a band four times. On August 27, 2011, Rivers Cuomo played the song acoustically to viewers on the streaming website Ustream. Cuomo also performed a solo, acoustic rendition of the song at a Weezer concert in Madison, Wisconsin on June 14, 2023.

Reception

The song received a positive review from Teenage Victory Songs, representing the positive reception that the band's more diehard fan base has shown the song. TVS included the song in "The Grand Playlist."

Weezer concert: 05/20/2002

Live, July 14, 2002

Personnel

Rivers Cuomo – lead guitar, lead vocals

Patrick Wilson – percussion

Brian Bell – rhythm guitar, backing vocals

Mikey Welsh – bass guitar, backing vocals

Ric Ocasek - producer

Lyrics

I miss you, and I wonder

How you feel about me too

Do you miss the way we'd play

And waste our time away?

Suddenly, we're apart

And I can't see you every night

Though we'd fight I loved you so much

Now I can't feel your touch

Oh, girlfriend

That's the end

And I'm lost without your love

Oh, love

In your arms, I was happy

As a little boy could be

Taking pills and mellowing out

Now I just want to shout

For your love, 'cause I'm drifting

Further from you every day

Driving by your place every night

I used to feel alright

Oh, girlfriend

That's the end

And I'm lost without your love

Oh, love

Feeling fancies every night

When I dream to be alright

Oh, love

Oh, love

Oh, girlfriend

That's the end

And I'm lost without your love

Oh, love

In your arms

I was happy as a little boy could be

Taking pills and mellowing out

Now I just want to shout

Do-do-do-do-do-do-do

Now I just want to shout

Do-do-do-do-do-do-do

Now I just want to shout
